intro: Rourea surinamensis, commonly known as the Surinam rourea, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its woody structure and showy inflorescences. The plant typically grows as an evergreen shrub or small tree, often found in tropical and subtropical regions. Its leaves are usually simple, alternate, and have a smooth or slightly hairy surface. The flowers are clustered in cyathia, a unique structure typical of the Euphorbiaceae family.
